item.title: Ticket #295 (Theme links still present when no theme or author URI) created
item.dc:creator: DarkCryst
item.description:
In the theme manager when "other themes" are listed the Theme name and author are always wrapped in links - whether they are provided or not.

If they are not then they are wrapped in an empty link, and so would link back to the themes page, which would not be expected behavior for the user. Some kind of conditional fix needed.

item.dc:creator: Isaack
item.description:
When entering Mass-edit mode, I have been unable to delete the selected comments for the past many versions.

I have just downloaded and tested nightly build of 15-09-04.

I'm running it on Apache2, Linux Redhat. The error I get back is,

Warning: Invalid argument supplied for foreach() in public_html/wp-admin/edit-comments.php on line 41

Note. I have deleted the true path

item.title: Ticket #278 (Upgrade from WordPress 1.0 breaks comments) updated
item.dc:creator: trbecker
item.description:
Ok, i"ve submitted the patch + Fix comment approval + $wpdb->query("UPDATE $wpdb->comments SET comment_approved = 0 WHERE comment_approved = 1"); + $wpdb->query("UPDATE $wpdb->comments SET comment_approved = 1 WHERE comment_approved = 2"); But it will break too if the upgrade is run twice. Ignore the patch.

edited on: 09-16-04 15:48

item.title: Ticket #292 (relative links in posts ought to be expanded to absolute links for feeds) created
item.dc:creator: skippy
item.description: A relative link in the body of a post will break when read in an aggregator. Is this a problem of the feed _consumer_ or the feed _producer_ ? It seems we ought to be able to convert relative links to absolute links on-the-fly when we detect that we're sending a feed.

item.dc:creator: matt
item.description: Resolution changed

item.title: Ticket #290 (post-slug not update) updated
item.dc:creator: matt
item.description: As it stands is the intended behaviour.

item.title: Ticket #290 (post-slug not update) updated
item.dc:creator: Michel Valdrighi
item.description:
That's not really a bug. It's intended for cases when you already modified the post-slug yourself, in this case WP shouldn't update the post-slug.

What we can do though, is check that the post-slug sent by the edit form is equal to the post-slug we would have gotten with the previous title. In this case, it could be safely assumed that the user didn't set the post-slug by herself, so WP could make a new one from the new title automatically.
